definition: to come into sight or view
details:
verb
- to come into sight or view
= example: to come into sight or view
- to come into being or existence
= example: to come into being or existence
= synonyms: come along
- to be issued or published
= example: to be issued or published
= synonyms: come out
- to show up as a character on stage, a play, or other similar media
= example: to show up as a character on stage, a play, or other similar media
- to give a certain impression or have a certain outward aspect
= example: to give a certain impression or have a certain outward aspect
= synonyms: look
- to seem to be true, probable, or apparent
= example: to seem to be true, probable, or apparent
= synonyms: seem
- to present oneself formally, as before an authority
= example: to present oneself formally, as before an authority
